note.para: Kit comes with one extra fork lever bolt and nord-lock washer assembly.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle. Read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service Manual for this engine.

To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting electrical components. See "Safety Information" in Engine Service Manual.
To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, make sure engine has cooled down before removing components. See "Safety Information" in Engine Service Manual.

svcproc.title: Diagnosis
svcproc.para: This procedure should be used when the turbocharger is suspected to be the cause of low power. This procedure will help determine if the cause is the turbocharger actuator, turbocharger assembly, electrical power or ground.

step1.para: Turn ignition key off. Try moving turbocharger linkage through its full range of motion by hand. Linkage should move smoothly and not chatter or hesitate. Also do bounce test by moving turbocharger linkage all the way out towards frame rail and let it go. Linkage should move towards engine, bounce, and stay there.

item.para: If linkage moves smoothly and passes bounce test, do step 2.
If linkage does not move smoothly or fails bounce test, remove turbocharger actuator and retest by moving linkage through its full range of motion.
If linkage then moves smoothly, replace turbocharger actuator.
If linkage does not move smoothly, replace turbocharger assembly.

step1.para: Turn ignition key on. Watch turbocharger linkage during pre-cycle movement. Linkage should move all the way out towards frame rail, move all the way back in towards engine, and move back out about half way. Check pre-cycle three times with at least three seconds of key-off time between tests.
Linkage should move through pre-cycle smoothly and not chatter, vibrate, hesitate or slow down during pre-cycle. Each pre-cycle should be completed in less then one second.

note.para: When pre-cycle is complete and key-on engine-off; linkage should not move by hand.

item.para: If pre-cycle passes, turbocharger or actuator may not be cause of low power. Verify all performance diagnostic tests on Performance Diagnostic Form EGED-290 do not indicate another cause. If low power complaint is intermittent and Performance Diagnostic Form has been completed without indicating another cause, do step 3.

step1.para: Connect turbocharger breakout harness between engine harness and actuator harness. Measure voltage between actuator power and ground terminals with key-on engine-off.

item.para: If pre-cycle failed and voltage is 10 volts or more, replace actuator.

If low power complaint is intermittent and voltage is 10 volts or more, inspect turbocharger power and ground wires for corroded or loose connections. If power and ground wires are properly connected, not corroded, and performance diagnostic tests do not indicate another cause of low power, replace actuator.
If voltage is low, repair low voltage problem and retest starting at step 2. (Refer to VGT Actuator section 7 of EGES-270 Engine Diagnostic Manual).

note.para: Turbocharger actuator can be retested with a known good power source and ground supplied directly through turbocharger actuator breakout harness.
